description.narrative:
It is the objective of the project to promote respect for the rights of sexual minorities in Ukraine by supporting the work undertaken by the organisation Gay Alliance Ukraine (GAU), inter alia in order to change the Ukrainian population's perception of sexual minorities, build organisational capacity and conduct advocacy campaigns during the period 2015-16.
Lesbian, homosexual, bisexual and transsexual persons (LGBT persons) face difficult conditions in Ukraine where they risk becoming victims of hate crimes, violence and discrimination. Based on a rights perspective GAU works to improve the situation.
GAU has a strategic plan with a number of goals: 1) improve the observation of the rights of sexual minorities, change the Ukrainian population's perception of sexual minorities, overcome stigmatization and support the self-respect of sexual minorities; 2) support LGBT persons living under difficult conditions, including sex workers;3) build capacity of the Ukrainian LGBT movement; 4) promote gender equality and support women's involvement in the LGBT movement; 5) promote sexual education to enhance sexual and reproductive health; 6) develop a democratic civil society; 7) further develop the capacity of GAU.
In cooperation with Swedish SIDA Denmark will provide core support to GAU thus enabling GAU to undertake activities which will contribute to reaching the organisation's strategic goals. Activities will include information and advocacy campaigns, Pride Parades in Kyiv and Odessa, monitoring of violence against LGBT persons and strategic litigation, support to capacity building of local activists, counselling for female victims of violence and development of GAU's webportal.
